metadata.title: CVE-2018-17433 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow in ReadGifImageDesc() in gifread.c in the HDFHDF5 through 1.10.3 library allows attackers to cause a denial of servicevia a crafted HDF5 file. This issue was triggered while converting a GIFfile to an HDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-103-1 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-fortran-102 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-hl-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-103-1 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-fortran-102 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-103-1 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-fortran-102 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1').
